DOC.brief_summary: Aim of this study is to evaluate the necessity of the radiological examinations of mentally handicapped or uncooperative patients.
DOC.brief_title: Radiological Examination of the Mentally Handicapped Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Dental radiography has become an indispensable part of routine dental examination with the help of the technological development of radiological devices. However, medical procedures like dental treatment and medical imaging (magnetic resonance imaging-MRI, computed tomography-CT, orthopantomography- OPG, etc.) that require cooperation are usually hard to apply to mentally handicapped (MHP) or uncooperative patients (UCP). Treatments that will be done without radiological examination can be missing or incorrect.
DOC.criteria: 1. Mentally Handicapped patients that radiological examination cannot performed 2. Suitable for IV sedation 1. Healthy Patients 2. Patients in which the radiological examination performed
